The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a rough texture, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Zosima pamirica is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
